intro: Neodissochaeta puberula, commonly known as the hairy sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its small, erect stature and is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has hairy leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Neodissochaeta puberula is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
